Axis-align an inventory polygon and rotate coordinates accordingly

create_aarect_inventory.Rd

This internal function ensures that the inventory zone is an axis-aligned rectangle. If the input polygon is not already a rectangle, the minimum-area enclosing rectangle is computed and rotated to align with the X and Y axes using the minimum possible rotation.

Usage

create_aarect_inventory(core_polygon_df, trees_inv, north2x, sensors = NULL)

Arguments

core_polygon_df

A validated data.frame defining the inventory polygon with columns x and y

trees_inv

A data.frame containing tree coordinates (x, y)

north2x

Numeric. Clockwise angle from North to the X-axis (degrees)

sensors

Optional data.frame containing sensor coordinates (x, y), or NULL

Value

A list with elements:

core_polygon_df

Axis-aligned rectangular polygon

trees_inv

Updated tree data.frame

sensors

Updated sensor data.frame (or NULL)

north2x

Updated orientation angle

rotation_rad

Applied rotation angle (radians)

Details

Tree and sensor coordinates are rotated consistently.
